description: Creates a virtual tape by using your own barcode. You write data to the virtual tape and then archive the tape. A barcode is unique and cannot be reused if it has already been used on a tape. This applies to barcodes used on deleted tapes. This operation is only supported in the tape gateway type.

parameters.name: GatewayARN
parameters.description: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that represents the gateway to associate the virtual tape with. Use the  ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Amazon Web Services Region.

parameters.name: TapeSizeInBytes
parameters.description: The size, in bytes, of the virtual tape that you want to create.

parameters.name: TapeBarcode
parameters.description: The barcode that you want to assign to the tape.

parameters.name: KMSEncrypted
parameters.description: Set to true to use Amazon S3 server-side encryption with your own KMS key, or false to use a key managed by Amazon S3. Optional. Valid Values: true | false.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A list of up to 50 tags that can be assigned to a virtual tape that has a barcode. Each tag is a key-value pair. (dict) --- A key-value pair that helps you manage, filter, and search for your resource. Allowed characters: letters, white space, and numbers, representable in UTF-8, and the following characters: + - = . _ : /. Tag key. The key can't start with aws:. Value of the tag key.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: Tag key. The key can't start with aws:.

nested_items.name: TapeARN
nested_items.description: A unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that represents the virtual tape that was created.
